reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Inclusive Economic Horizon for discriminated women; From narrow economic opportunities to fair share in the workforce - CEOSS

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is:Contributing positively and effectively with the concerned duty bearers and stakeholders to eradicate poverty gender based inequality and discrimination of poor and marginalized women in rural and urban areas and wor k to increase their economic opportunities accessibilities and active participation in the work force.The proposed project is targeting 280 poor and discriminated artisan women graduates and those with lower levels of education who are working in the info rmal economy sector 200 will be targeted for the informal economy sector and 80 will be targeted from the artisans women. Proposed interventions for the women in the informal sector will include women empowerment activities to enable them to be self organi zed and have their self representation to be able to advocate for their rights at the local community level: the process starts by electing women representatives and forming their local democratically elected committees provision of a series of workshops t o enhance the role of the democratically elected committees. Local community sensitization and raising awareness activities regarding the importance of work in the informal sector and its benefits towards women socioeconomic situation in the community. Act ivities will be carried out to engage the duty bearers the supporters private sector representatives to play an active role in women empowerment and enrollment in the formal sector and workforce. Provision of activities for building the skills of the targ eted women to increase their productivity and small business performance.As for women artisans interventions will include needs assessment activities in order to identify challenges and problems faced by those women in the labor market. Accordingly a set o f training activities will be carried out to fulfill the needs in the area of gender equality and women's rights in the workforce. The trainings will also cover the administrative skills needed by artisans women to be able to compete in the workforce. Furt hermore another set of activities will be provided for the women artisans which include building linkages effective marketing and competitiveness ability; through roundtable discussion and a variety of meetings. The project stresses the sharing of knowledg e information and sustain the continuation for the targeted women artisans

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity
Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is the main priority area in this activ ity
